page.title: 17A Diabetic Girl - My Day
page.content: I am an 11 year old girl who has had diabetes for 10 months.At 7.15am I go downstairs and do a blood or a urine test for sugar.My bloodsugar should be 4.4-6.7 but if it is below 4.4 I am hypo.This means not enough sugar is in my blood and I feel unwell.Above 13.3 is hyper, this is too much sugar in the blood and needs treatment. At 7.30 am I have my injection [Human Montard U 100 Insulin]. At the moment I am on 14 units.[June 1985] At 8.00am I have breakfast a normal size bowl of cereal. At school I keep an emergency kit which contains a small lucazade, some glucose tablets and biscuits,these are in case I have a hypo. At 10.30 I have a packet of crisps and then nothing until 12.00 when I have sandwiches, yogurt and an apple. AT 5.00 I have my main meal. At bedtime I do a test and have some cereal.
